title: French top court nixes cushy visa deal for rich Brits
description: "The Constitutional Court has green-lit the government's original bill," Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin, who spearheaded the legislation, tweeted on X. "Never has a law provided so many means for expelling delinquents and so many obligations to integrate newcomers."

title: Timms warns Labour not to support assisted dying
description: In an article published on the Labour List website on Wednesday, Sir Stephen writes that it is “myth” that support for the legalisation of assisted dying is a left-wing position “in contrast to uncompassionate, reactionary Conservatives who wish to condemn those suffering to undignified deaths”.

title: Reform UK support surges to record high
description: Reform UK is more popular than at any point in its history, according to opinion polling, which shows 13 per cent of Britons would vote for the party if the general election was held now.

title: PM insists he is ‘making progress’ despite Tory warnings of electoral ‘massacre’
description: Rishi Sunak has told Conservatives fearing they face being electorally “massacred” that he is “making progress”, as he urged them to stick with his plan. Former Cabinet minister Sir Simon Clarke’s warning that the Tories face oblivion at the next election without a change in the Prime Minister was followed by fresh gloom from an adviser.

title: Penny Mordaunt slaps down Labour as she launches passionate Rishi Sunak defence
description: Penny Mordaunt slapped down Labour as she launched a passionate defence of Rishi Sunak in the Commons today. The Commons Leader insisted the Prime Minister "doesn't just get Britain, he represents the best of Great Britain".

title: Politics latest news: Tories ‘serve no purpose’, says Farage after Reform records highest ever support
description: Nigel Farage claimed the Red Wall will desert the Tories at the next general election with Rishi Sunak as leader. Mr Farage said that with Mr Sunak leading the Conservative Party “the Red Wall is completely and utterly gone”.

title: Lib Dems will 'bring back community policing', says new PCC candidate
description: Paul Kennedy has been confirmed as the Liberal Democrat candidate bidding to oust the Conservatives in Surrey’s Police and Crime Commissioner (PCC) elections on May 2, 2024.

title: Reform UK won't field candidate for York and North Yorkshire mayor
description: Reform UK has confirmed that it will not field a candidate in May’s York and North Yorkshire’s mayoral election.

title: Johnson and Braverman silent as Tories distance themselves from Sunak coup plot
description: Suella Braverman and Boris Johnson remained silent over whether they backed the latest bid to remove Rishi Sunak as other potential Conservative leadership contenders said they would stand by the Prime Minister.

title: Why Labour must improve relations with Europe
description: An election that many believed Labour was destined to win, having led in the polls for most of the preceding year, ended in a fourth consecutive majority for the Tories. The 14.1 million votes cast for John Major’s party remains the highest total ever recorded by any party.
